primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The preservation and restoration of the human body as the temple of the Holy Spirit and a member of Christ's body against the defilement of lust.

tekstueel_bewijs: decide where you want to live—decide now
you must run to save your soul

zender.identificatie: God as the Life of the Soul/The Apostle Paul
tekstueel_bewijs: the Lord has urged you to fear
God is the life of the soul

ontvanger.identificatie: The Hearer (as the one who either inherits the 'land of the living' or Gehenna)
tekstueel_bewijs: no fornicator... will possess the kingdom of God

helper.identificatie: Fear (Servile and Chaste) and Grace (as a strengthening agent)
tekstueel_bewijs: this horror of hell... acts as a bridle
the foe you dread is right here
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a habit but a force that leads to eternal 'Gehenna' and the separation of the soul from God.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Soteriological foundation: Christ becoming man to unite our bodies to His.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Christ
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon begins with Christ's action (Soteriology) but quickly shifts to the Hearer's responsibility (Ethics) as the primary focus.

voorbeelden_god_subject: the Lord has urged you to fear
voorbeelden_mens_subject: you must run to save your soul
decide where you want to live
you still won’t deserve to be praised

voorbeelden: you must run to save your soul
let him respect Christ dwelling in him
decide where you want to live

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily prescriptive. It assumes the hearer has the 'Pouvoir' (power) to decide and act, provided they are sufficiently motivated by 'Devoir' (fear of hell).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From False Security (~S2) to Servile Fear (~S1), then aiming for Perfect Love (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through the internal psychological shift from fear of punishment to love of the Father.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 (Eternal Fire) is used as the primary rhetorical engine.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon starts with a strong Christological foundation (Christ as Head), the bulk of the narrative engine is anthropocentric, focusing on the hearer's willpower, fear, and decision-making.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: you must run to save your soul
if you sin, I’ll abandon you

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Christ became our Head... our bodies are his members
it’s the letter threatening you, not yet grace strengthening you

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Virgins are used as a 'heroic' model of those who do more than the command to motivate the 'slaves' (married/ordinary people).
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on Christ as the only truly Chaste One who preserves His temple despite our failures.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation is presented as something the hearer must 'run' to secure.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from 'Christ has united us' to 'You must save yourself' creates a structural tension between gift and task.
spanning_punten: God as the 'Life of the soul' vs. 'You can kill your soul'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Christ became our Head... our bodies are his members

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Love' that replaces 'Fear', but the hearer must 'welcome' it.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Eternal destruction; loss of the 'Life of the soul'.

eschatologie.actant_van_voltooiing: Man (through choosing the right dwelling place)

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'Recruitment' narrative where the hearer is the Subject and God is the prize or the judge. Christ's work is the 'pre-condition' but not the 'active power' in the present struggle.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is told to 'run to save your soul', making them the Savior.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Position Christ as the one who runs to save the soul.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'You must run to save your soul', use 'Christ has run into the fire of Gehenna to pull your soul out'.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the hero who must 'adorn' themselves.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Temple' being rebuilt by the Architect.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Focus on God as the active builder/purifier.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that the Spirit doesn't just watch, but actively kills the lust the hearer cannot kill.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Hell/Satan) is already very intense.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The 'Secondary Program' (Ethics) has swallowed the 'Primary Program' (Soteriology).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Ground the ability to be chaste entirely in the fact that Christ *already* owns the body.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a brilliant Christological opening, but the preacher's pastoral anxiety leads to a moralistic 'Subject-switch' in the middle sections.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the fear-tactics are effective; semiotically, they reveal a shift in agency from God to Man.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis confirms the 'Temple' metaphor, but semiotics shows the preacher uses the metaphor as a 'burden' rather than a 'gift'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that 'Love' is treated as a 'Modal Competence' that the Subject must acquire to move from 'Slave' to 'Son'.

appendices.notnotes: The sermon is a classic example of 'Pedagogical Moralism' where grace is the goal rather than the starting point.
